titleStmt.title: W. D. Carpenter to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11553

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lt. Col Silas Adams com Colonel 1st cavalry June 5. 1864 vice Frank Wolford dismissed

Hd Qrs 1st Ky Cav
Allatoona Geo
June 5" 1864.
Gov Bramlette
Sir --

As a vacancy exists in this Regiment as Colonel= we the undersigned officers of said Regiment do Resptly petition your Exciellency to Commission Lt Col Silas Adams as Colonel of the 1st Ky Cav vice Col Wolford out of service. Col Adams is so well known as as Cavalry officer. he needs no recommendation from us, a like petition was sent you some time since, but we have heard nothing from it. Our Regiment numbers over one Thousand men, and are is entitled to all the officers allowed a Cavalry Regiment.

signed
W D Carpenter
Thos Rowland
James S Pankey

I have copied this from the original petition signed by every officer, And I Certify that we have on the Regimental Rolls over one thousand men, we have here in the front over five hundred men mounted Twice as many as any other Cavalry Regiment in Genl Stoneman's Command. we need more field officers in the Regiment. Col Adams is Commanding a Brigade. Major Owens is a prisoner. Maj Drye is at home wounded and we have only one Field officer with the Regiment.

I am very Resptly
Your obt Servt
W D Carpenter
adjt 1st Ky Cav,

Hd qrs 1s Ky Cavl
Alltoona Ga
June 5th 1864
To the Governor asking the Lt Col Silas Adams be commissioned Colonel vice Woolford out of the service.
